name: Fish in Foil
author: Denyse
summary: The 'no smell' fish recipe that is the ONLY one I make for my family (I hate fish, they LOVE it!). Take foil packets to table for service, and keep them around for the discarding of bones and skin. Then when dinner's done, haul those babies to the outside trash.
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Rub fillets with olive oil, and season with garlic salt and black pepper
Place each fillet on a large sheet of aluminum foil
Top with jalapeno slices, and squeeze the juice from the ends of the lemons over the fish
Arrange lemon slices on top of fillets
Carefully seal all edges of the foil to form enclosed packets
Bake in preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes, depending on the size of fish
Fish is done when it flakes easily with a fork
